newsitem.title: UK: INSIGHT - Stg holds 2.7750 marks after break lower.
newsitem.headline: INSIGHT - Stg holds 2.7750 marks after break lower.

text.p: Sterling held onto strong support around 2.7750 marks after last night's sharp slide and this bodes well for a claw higher near-term, technical analysts said.

Sterling dived four pfennigs overnight on a Bridge News report quoting an unnamed Labour party source as saying sterling should rejoin Europe's exchange rate mechanism (ERM) in 2001 at a rate of 2.50 marks.
But 2.7750 marks, the lower end of the mid-April range held and a recovery back to 2.80 marks is on the cards, particularly if dollar/mark can recover further, analysts said.
At 0726 GMT sterling was at 2.7880/90 marks after getting down to 2.7753 in the immediate aftermath of the Bridge report. It closed on Wednesday in Europe at 2.8151/61.
If sterling/mark manages to get back to 2.80, the mid-point of the recent range a test up to Wednesday's close of 2.8150-60 is likely, analysts said.
On the downside long-term trendline support stands at 2.7500 marks but en-route 2.7750 will continue to be a major prop.
Cable slid to $1.6124 overnight but by early Europe had recovered to $1.6265/75. It closed on Wednesday at $1.6366/75.
Cable's break back up above $1.62 was good news and sets up a push back above $1.63, probably today, analysts said. Congestion in the $1.6380-6400 will provide the next upside resistance point.
Sterling/yen held 200.00 for another test up to 203.65 and higher, they added.
RSI - 14 day: Sterling/mark: 46 pct, sterling/dollar: 37m pct
